data.title: Project handling improvements
data.body:
-  Only build PCL + Desktop when refreshing project assembly from Atomic Editor
-  Fix for issue with Graphics::RaiseWindow on Windows (fixed in SDL)
-  Protect against launching more than one player processes
- Additional clarification messages for builds

data.title: Restoring ability to load examples directly from AtomicExamples repo
DebugHud not exposed to C#
Make it possible to load a C# example directly from the AtomicExamples repo
data.body:
There is some local setup required for projects, what needs to happen is that when opening a project, the editor should detect a "Template" and initiate the create project dialog or just create it locally in the repo, which would help when working on examples

For now, `Build_AtomicEditor.sh --with-examples` or cloning the AtomicExamples repo to `AtomicGameEngine/Data/AtomicEditor/AtomicExamples` will show the examples on the welcome screen where they can be checked out

data.title: Adding/updating --with-web for Build_AtomicEditor
Atomic C# interface mixins
data.body:
- Serializer/Deserializer interfaces now properly specified with generated members for both the interface and implementation classes, including overloads 
- Adds custom File Read/Write for arrays of bytes

data.title: Allow animation generation for skeleton hierarchies without skinned meshes
data.body: This change allows users to import animations into the engine without having to include a model's skinned mesh in each export. Facilitates a common work flow used in other game engines.

data.title: Resource to Cache mapping at runtime, consistent StringHash C# mapping
Adding interface support to C# scripting
data.body: This PR picks up native API related to Serializer/Deserializer interfaces

data.title: Profiler improvements
data.body:
Divided the triangles into categories "All pass", "Single pass" and "Editor"

Created a profiler widget to be added to the scene that lets you view the information easier when a scene is open
Added that a widgets disabled opacity be set without changing it in skin

data.title: linux xbuild config test
data.body:
Test for the existence of xbuild by looking for it as an installed program, instead of using a node command.
I didn't know if you wanted the OSX to do the same thing, so I left it as is, since it was working.

data.title: Remove exception from native type wrapping
data.body:
Attempting to wrap a native of unknown type no longer throws an exception, instead returns null with optional logging, these cases are quite rare and as C# is strongly typed, mostly happen when querying event data.  

For example, Renderer2D is an internal native class which generates a component added event, the event data will now have a null for the component parameter, instead of throwing an exception when accessed

data.title: Instead of throwing on unknown native when adding component without script bindings, output a debug message
data.body: Use Renderer2D component in a scene load to trigger the exception

data.title: Expose Renderer2D to script
Adding the Web subsystem back to Engine.cpp
data.body: Merging the current Urho3D was really good, but it did have some casualties. The Web subsystem was giving a null because it was never registered. This PR fixes that problem.

data.title: Parse class doc strings
Map FBX/Blend file requests to mdl extension at runtime
data.body: It isn't intuitive to load a model resource in the project at Resources/Models/Box.fbx using the file path Resources/Models/Box.mdl, the runtime should map fbx, blend, etc requests

data.title: - Material inspector now removes references to textures correctly
data.body: - Stopped the project frame from referencing the texture being assigned from the resource select menu.
